intro: Tetrastigma jinghongense, commonly known as Jinghong crossvine, is a climbing vine native to China, specifically Yunnan Province. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its tendrils and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically followed by red or orange berries. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
